data.event: The U.S. Census Bureau estimated 2014 population is 20,905.

event.title: 1735, the colonial government of King George II established

data.event: In 1735, the colonial government of King George II established eleven townships in backcountry South Carolina, to encourage settlement, and to provide a buffer between Native American tribes to the West and colonial plantations in the Lowcountry.
The Battle of Tarrar Springs was fought nearby on November 16, 1781.
In 1785, Saxe Gotha was replaced with Lexington County, in commemoration of the Battles of Lexington and Concord in Massachusetts.

event.title: was incorporated as the Town of Lexington in 1861

data.event: The community was incorporated as the Town of Lexington in 1861.
